text: welcome to the children of martyrs
school most of the pupils have lost one
parent or both to Syria's Civil War
there are tens of thousands more like
them as the UNHCR here in Turkey and in
Jordan and Lebanon a generation of
children has been left traumatized by
the war some watched a mother or father
killed here they draw what they
witnessed returning to the same horrific
images again and again initial fear why
he was I remember losing his father the
family woke to hear of planes my dad
told me to hide in the toilet he says he
went out to rescue someone the missile
landed though she's just blood that was
too afraid to show her face her father
was killed she explains and she goes on
Bashar Assad might kill the rest of my
family two twins who died and lo I
described how their family fled in the
back of a truck
and her village was shelled the truck
was ambushed
my mum was hit here here and here he
says he explains how she died in front
of them
refugees are disadvantaged right from
the start
one-year-old Mohammed does not have a
birth certificate it would cost $100 and
take months as his father many births
aren't registered because parents fled
without documents the children are
stateless it could make returned home
impossible to be a child refugee is
often to assume a crushing burden of
responsibility many have to work to
support their families it can be
back-breaking long hours for little pay
just a few dollars a day they have no
choice a child may be the family's only
breadwinner UNHCR officials talk about a
lost generation of Syrian children they
call the 1.1 million child refugees a
shameful milestone of the conflict it is
though a crisis with no end in sight in
Lebanon around one in four of the
population is a refugee yet every day
more across the border
half of them children Allwood BBC News
Beirut
